intro: Critesion comosum, commonly known as the hairy comosum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist to saturated soil conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. The showy yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
